title: Help! latency with telstra.
body:
Having mass latency spikes in game to the point its unplayable. Here are two diagnostic readouts.

Anyone else with Telstra having issues at the moment?

replies.body:
I'm actually having the same problem! Telstra cable, speed boost, otherwise flawless connection. I've tried replacing the cabling, router, etc. When I play from friends places, the office, etc it's fine but

I spoke to one of the guys here and they suggested following the steps in this [thread](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/P74th11d-oce-network-diagnostics-tool) 

Good luck!!

> Having mass latency spikes in game to the point its unplayable. Here are two diagnostic readouts.
> 
> Anyone else with Telstra having issues at the moment?

Hi Havocry,
I have been going through your results and have noticed some commonalities between the ones to our servers and the ones you have done to bigpond and google. Please see the image I have attached and notice the highlighted sections.

All these "hops" are within the Telstra network and no matter which service your and trace routing too (Our game servers, google or bigpond themselves) you are constantly getting a high connection to them. This indicates to me that the path your internet connection is taking is (nearly) always going through these hops and causing you high latency. Unfortunately there is not much we can do from here as it is Telstra's infrasturcture.

What you could try doing (and I know you mentioned you have called them already) is speaking to their technicians with showing them the trace routes you have run and see if they can do anything about those hops having issues.

Some common problems could be:
1. congestion
2. an issue with the hardware
3. over subscription in that area

Secondly I noticed you are using a wireless connection to your router, it is highly advised that using a wired connection is preferable when playing league as otehr factors can cause issues with wireless.
For example:
1. ducted airconditioning
2. storms

We are sorry you are experiencing these issues, but hopefully the information I have provided can enable you to work with Telstra to restore your connection to better, more enjoyable playing state.

-ToxicHawk

Reviving this thread as I'm experiencing the same issues.
Begining about 9:10pm

There's something *very* dodgy going on with Telstra modems.

Very long story short, try going into the modem settings and **changing the name of your wifi** and see if that fixes it.

> There's something *very* dodgy going on with Telstra modems.
> 
> Very long story short, try going into the modem settings and **changing the name of your wifi** and see if that fixes it.

**Yo I'm not kidding if you haven't tried this do so and let me know if anything changes please. Let me know if you need more help with it.**

Good bloke toxichawk. Helping the noobs understand technology.

Yeah pretty much tell your ISP that you will change service providers if they don't figure out the problem. That usually gets them going because if they don't seem interested in getting it fixed, they could lose their job. :D
Thank God mine is fine, I wouldn't want to DC while playing a real game, like Final Fantasy.

Telstra's been bought out by Vodafone iirc, and I've just been having awful ping spikes constantly. It's not league-specific either, I just don't notice it much while browsing the internet, but it's just their %%%%ty service.

> Telstra's been bought out by Vodafone iirc, and I've just been having awful ping spikes constantly. It's not league-specific either, I just don't notice it much while browsing the internet, but it's just their %%%%ty service.

Telstra in NZ maybe. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TelstraClear

I have been having insane ping issues with iinet lately as well, i think its the riot servers.

When i check speedtest I sit around 40 ping which is normal for me but as soon as I play LoL it spikes to 130+
My ping is fine in every other game I have tested it.

My ping sits at 60 & every 10-20 secs i get a mass ping spike

also with telstra
Contact them and i get the same type of response "Have you tried changing your WiFi channel".
